title: History and Citizenship: Resources for a Critially Empowered Public
abstractText: This project is intended to assist in raising the standing of history as a constituent of public debate in Britain, at a time when there is concern about the prerequisite for active citizenship. The current popularity of history rest primarily in its association with 'heritage' and with identity politics. This project make the case for historical thinking as a critical and practical resource, by demonstrating policies towards the supposed 'crisis in the family'. The argument has important implications for the approach to history taken in schools and in the media.
